data.title: Amazon set to launch new grocery store separate from Whole Foods: report
data.text: Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, -0.80% is reportedly opening a new grocery store separate from its existing Whole Foods and Amazon Go chains.

data.title: New Amazon Grocery Store Plan Revealed In Help Wanted Post
data.text: Amazon plans to launch a new supermarket brand distinct from the Whole Foods Market chain or Amazon Go stores, with the first store set to open in Woodland Hills, Calif., sometime in 2020.

data.title: Why this analyst is raising his retail sales forecast for the holidays
data.text: Greg Melich of Evercore ISI joins CNBC's "Power Lunch" team to break down the countdown to the holiday shopping season, his outlook for the retail sector and the pulse of the American consumer.

data.title: Big Tech’s battle with Seattle is just getting started — and it could have implications nationwide
data.text: Bernie Sanders reveled in Amazon’s defeat.

data.title: Amazon to open its ‘first grocery store,’ with new format separate from Whole Foods and Amazon Go
data.text: Amazon ratcheted up its ambitions in the grocery business again on Monday, confirming plans for a new grocery format set to debut in California next year.

data.title: 15 years of blogging at Amazon: Lessons in DIY communications from Jeff Barr, the voice of AWS
data.text: Back in 2004, when Jeff Barr started a blog for Amazon Web Services, no one was really sure how it would turn out — including Barr himself.

data.title: Is Amazon Doubling Down On Groceries With Second Brand?
data.text: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) confirmed Monday it plans on opening a second brand of grocery stores.

data.title: Amazon to open its first non-Whole Foods grocery store in 2020
data.text: Amazon is opening its first non-Whole Foods grocery store in the L.A. neighborhood of Woodland Hills, the retailer today confirmed.

data.title: Amazon is launching its own grocery store in Los Angeles next year
data.text: Amazon plans to open a new grocery store in Woodland Hills in 2020.

data.title: There's a race to replace our iPhones with smart glasses we wear everywhere
data.text: Microsoft, Snap, Facebook, Google, Apple and Amazon are all racing to replace our phones with glasses we wear everywhere.

data.title: Amazon will launch new grocery store as alternative to Whole Foods
data.text: The company confirmed plans for a new store format after job openings were posted Monday.

data.title: Amazon and Woody Allen settle $68M lawsuit over cancelled film deal
data.text: Amazon and Woody Allen reached an undisclosed settlement that will put to rest a $68 million lawsuit filed earlier this year by the director over an aborted movie deal.

data.title: Amazon's $1.5 million political gambit backfires in Seattle City Council election
data.text: Seattle voters, in a rebuke to heavy corporate campaign spending by Amazon.com, have kept progressives firmly in control of their city council, reviving chances for a tax on big businesses that the tech giant helped fend off last year.

data.title: Woody Allen and Amazon settle $68 million legal battle over canceled movie contract
data.text: Allen sued Amazon for allegedly breaching the four-picture deal, which was to "finance and distribute his future films and to be his 'home' for the rest of his career," according to the suit, filed in February.

data.title: 'A' List Tech Investment Trifecta: Apple, Amazon, Avago (Broadcom)
data.text: Here is a simple long-term investment strategy for investing in leading technology growth stocks starting with the letter "A".
